ygData.subject: Re: Bujold
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Step by step would be to use a stringed instrument to target each individual blue and then pull the yellow to your group, or back from the monsters to
ygData.messageBody:
> A couple of questions from a new bard on your list. (I apologize
> if these have been asked before) BTW, this is by far the most
> interesting and mature Everquest list that I have seen so far. Must
> say something about the type of person that enjoys playing a bard.
> (join the EQ_clerics list for a bit and you'll see what I mean...)
>
> 1. Exactly how do you use the Level 8 lull song? Is it an area
> effect song or do you have to target each MOB in turn? Perhaps a
>step
> by step description of the proper tactics to use when facing a group
> of yellwo-blue monsters would best illustrate this. (thanks)
Step by step would be to use a stringed instrument to target each individual
blue and then pull the yellow to your group, or back from the monsters to
solo. Using an instrument seems to make a it last longer as you pull the
yellow one out. Then you can use your hotkeyed melee/inventory slot to
switch to your weapons and finish the critter off.

> 2. Did anyone else notice how quiet it was last night on the
> Everquest servers? They only had about 60% of their normal
> population. Guess there is a strong correlation between playing
> Everquest and being a Star Wars fan... :smiles knowingly.
> I expect that the next few days may be a good time to grab some
> experience at those place that always seem to be over camped.
>
Hehe, I did enjoy the movie personally.

> 3. I am a Level 10 human Bard. I usually party with an Enchanter
> (good combo, the pet tanks, she zaps and I tank/support) but I am
> rather poor. Any good suggestions on location or MOBS that garner a
> goodly amount of loot so I can finish my banded ensemble?
>
Alright, are you a human bard Freeport or Qeynos? Because my recommendation
is to hunt in lesser fay and take out Nybrights. If you are near Qeynos I
believe they have some bandit camps as well. The thing that makes them so
desirable is that they have bronze weapons which are worth 2 plat or so, and
they provide good experience as you are only 10th lvl. Generally they are
camped out in lesser faydark, but I have seen the more mature adventurers
hunt there who split them evenly with other groups, but expect a long wait
if a lot of people are there.

> Thanks in advance,
>
> Bujold (Xegony) (look no e.. :))
Your welcome fellow loregatherer,
Journeyman Bryne
"May luck, loot, and lore find you on your travels"
